Class TerrarithmeticApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • TerrarithmeticApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TerrarithmeticApp
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The TerrarithmeticApp class serves as a driver class for the game.

    TerrarithmeticApp

    Date: 2016/05/6

    Version:
    1 2016/05/6
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TerrarithmeticApp

        public TerrarithmeticApp()
        This constructor creates all the components of the game, links them together, and adds them to the main card layout.

        Local variables:

        quitItem This is used to create a quit item in the menu bar.

        aboutItem This is used to create an about item in the menu bar.

        fileMenu This is used to create the file menu bar.

        helpMenu This is used to create the help menu bar.

        myMenus This is used to create the menu bar.

    • Method Detail

      • switchGamePanel

        public void switchGamePanel(Player player,
                            CardGameNPC opponent)
        This method switches the GamePanel to be in view and starts a new card game.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who will be playing in the game.
        opponent - the computer who will be playing in the game.

      • mainMenu

        public void mainMenu(java.lang.String stop)
        This method switches the focus of the screen to the main menu.
        Parameters:
        stop - the String reference of which panel in the CardLayout will be stopped.

      • switchOpenWorld

        public void switchOpenWorld(java.lang.String stop)
        This method switches the focus of the screen to the OpenWorld panel.
        Parameters:
        stop - the String reference of which panel in the CardLayout will be stopped.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame()
        This method handles the loading of an already started game.

      • newGame

        public void newGame(java.lang.String character,
                    java.lang.String saveName)
        This method handles the creation of a new game.

        Local variables:

        out This is used as reference to the PrintWriter class to write the data to the save state.

        Parameters:
        character - the character to be used in the new save.
        saveName - the name to be displayed on the leaderboard.

      • copyFile

        public void copyFile(java.lang.String in,
                     java.lang.String out)
        This method copies the contents of one file to another.
        Parameters:
        in - the input file.
        out - the output file.

      • credits

        public void credits()
        This method swaps the focus of the screen to the credits screen and displays the animation.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        This method is used for determining what should take place after certain actions.

        Local variables:

        x This stores the JOptionPane input that the user enters.

        label The label used to display the About dialog.

        myDialog The box that will display the About dialog text.

        button The button that will close the dialog.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - This is used as reference to ActionEvent

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Description of main(String [] args) This method calls the DatabaseApp constructor to create the application.
        Parameters:
        args - [ ] String array that allows command line parameters to be used when executing the program.
